result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher J. Larson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher J. Larson was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (5/23/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or set up a payment plan within said time.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment hearing on February 28, 2017 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Christopher J. Larson in court with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; victim rights complied with; no restitution; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Count 2 Misd. Retail Theft; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of Count 2 Misd. Retail Theft w/Count 1 Dismissed; State heard; Atty. Moeller heard; Court imposes sentence

* $200 F+C = $515.00 within 60 days or 14 days
* $200 DNA surcharge and sample

Defendant Christopher J. Larson in court with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Moeller heard, parties came to an agreement - Def. will participate in AODA assessment which is scheduled for 3/8, reqeust PLEAS hearing after that date. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Christopher J. Larson in court with attorney Jessica M. Moeller.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

12:45 - Atty Barrington for State. Def in person w/Atty Moeller. Missed Arraignment. Atty Moeller heard. Atty Barrington heard. Court heard; reinstates bond w/prior conditions. Arraignment reset to 6/3 8:15 Br 3.

8:27 am. Attorney Jessica M. Moeller appeared.  Atty. Gilbert Thompson appears for the State.  Court issues warrant on non-appearance, Atty. Moeller requests warrant stayed.  Warrant stayed until Friday at 12:45, case will be called at 12:45 in Branch 5.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher J. Larson

Prior: 105 Elm Street, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

9:19 - Defendant, Christopher J. Larson in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. New address given: 820 S. Lincoln #201, Beaver Dam WI. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.
